title: FORECASTING SYSTEMIC RISK OF CHINA'S BANKING INDUSTRY BY PARTIAL DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS MODEL AND COMPLEX NETWORK
abstract: The monitoring and controlling of systemic risk have increasingly become the focus of attention in the financial field. It is important and difficult to accurately forecast systemic financial risk. In this paper, we propose a spatio-temporal partial differential equation model to describe the systemic risk of China's Banking Industry based on network, clustering, and real date of 24 China's A-share listed banks. The model considers the combined influence of local risk and transboundary contagion effects, and the prediction relative accuracy is up to 95%. Simulation results confirm that strict joint control measures, the timeliness of central bank intervention, and differences in bank strategies are efficient for reducing systemic risk. To our knowledge, this is the first paper to apply a PDE model to forecast systemic financial risk.
